page.title: 13URCHFONT MANOR
page.content: URCHFONT MANOR IS AN ELEGANT 17TH CENTURY HOUSE SITUATED IN A SMALL LANDSCAPED PARKLAND TO THE WEST OF THE ROAD FROM URCHFONT TO MARKET LAVINGTON B3908. IT IS REACHED BY A DRIVEWAY THE GROUNDS TO THE NORTH AND EAST HAVING MANY LARGE AND ESTABLISHED TREES. THE HOUSE IS BUILT OF BRICK WITH STONE DRESSINGS, THE EAST FRONT FACING TO WARDS SAILSBURY PLAIN. AN ATTRACTIVE COURTYARD ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE HOUSE IS SURROUNDED BY STABLES AND OUT BUILDINGS WITH LARGE WALLED GARDENS WHERE FRUIT AND VEGETABLES ARE GROWN. THERE IS A SMALL SHOP IN THE BASEMENT OF THE MANOR RUN BY THE THE FRIENDS OF URCHFONT MANOR WHERE CRAFT ITEMS CAN BE BOUGHT TO SUPPORT THE AIMS AND ACTIVITIES OF THE COLLEGE. REGULAR EXHIBITIONS OF PAINTINGS AND CRAFTWORK ARE ORGANIZED.
